name: Zechariah 10:6
text: "I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph, and I will bring them back; for I have mercy on them; and they will be as though I had not cast them off: for I am Yahweh their God, and I will hear them.

name: Zechariah 10:7
text: Ephraim will be like a mighty man, and their heart will rejoice as through wine; yes, their children will see it, and rejoice. Their heart will be glad in Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 10:8
text: I will signal for them, and gather them; for I have redeemed them; and they will increase as they have increased.

name: Zechariah 10:9
text: I will sow them among the peoples; and they will remember me in far countries; and they will live with their children, and will return.

name: Zechariah 10:10
text: I will bring them again also out of the land of Egypt, and gather them out of Assyria; and I will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon; and there won"t be room enough for them.

name: Zechariah 10:11
text: He will pass through the sea of affliction, and will strike the waves in the sea, and all the depths of the Nile will dry up; and the pride of Assyria will be brought down, and the scepter of Egypt will depart.

name: Zechariah 10:12
text: I will strengthen them in Yahweh; and they will walk up and down in his name," says Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 11:1
text: Open your doors, Lebanon, that the fire may devour your cedars.

name: Zechariah 11:2
text: Wail, fir tree, for the cedar has fallen, because the stately ones are destroyed. Wail, you oaks of Bashan, for the strong forest has come down.

name: Zechariah 11:3
text: A voice of the wailing of the shepherds! For their glory is destroyed: a voice of the roaring of young lions! For the pride of the Jordan is ruined.

name: Zechariah 11:4
text: Thus says Yahweh my God: "Feed the flock of slaughter.

name: Zechariah 11:5
text: Their buyers slaughter them, and go unpunished. Those who sell them say, "Blessed be Yahweh, for I am rich;" and their own shepherds don"t pity them.

name: Zechariah 11:6
text: For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land," says Yahweh; "but, behold, I will deliver the men everyone into his neighbor"s hand, and into the hand of his king. They will strike the land, and out of their hand I will not deliver them."

name: Zechariah 11:7
text: So I fed the flock of slaughter, especially the oppressed of the flock. I took for myself two staffs. The one I called "Favor," and the other I called "Union," and I fed the flock.

name: Zechariah 11:8
text: I cut off the three shepherds in one month; for my soul was weary of them, and their soul also loathed me.

name: Zechariah 11:9
text: Then I said, "I will not feed you. That which dies, let it die; and that which is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let those who are left eat each other"s flesh."

name: Zechariah 11:10
text: I took my staff Favor, and cut it apart, that I might break my covenant that I had made with all the peoples.

name: Zechariah 11:11
text: It was broken in that day; and thus the poor of the flock that listened to me knew that it was the word of Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 11:12
text: I said to them, "If you think it best, give me my wages; and if not, keep them." So they weighed for my wages thirty pieces of silver.

name: Zechariah 11:13
text: Yahweh said to me, "Throw it to the potter, the handsome price that I was valued at by them!" I took the thirty pieces of silver, and threw them to the potter, in the house of Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 11:14
text: Then I cut apart my other staff, even Union, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.

name: Zechariah 11:15
text: Yahweh said to me, "Take for yourself yet again the equipment of a foolish shepherd.

name: Zechariah 11:16
text: For, behold, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, who will not visit those who are cut off, neither will seek those who are scattered, nor heal that which is broken, nor feed that which is sound; but he will eat the flesh of the fat sheep, and will tear their hoofs in pieces.

name: Zechariah 11:17
text: Woe to the worthless shepherd who leaves the flock! The sword will be on his arm, and on his right eye. His arm will be completely withered, and his right eye will be totally blinded!"

name: Zechariah 12:1
text: An oracle. The word of Yahweh concerning Israel. Yahweh, who stretches out the heavens, and lays the foundation of the earth, and forms the spirit of man within him says:

name: Zechariah 12:2
text: "Behold, I will make Jerusalem a cup of reeling to all the surrounding peoples, and on Judah also will it be in the siege against Jerusalem.

name: Zechariah 12:3
text: It will happen in that day, that I will make Jerusalem a burdensome stone for all the peoples. All who burden themselves with it will be severely wounded, and all the nations of the earth will be gathered together against it.

name: Zechariah 12:4
text: In that day," says Yahweh, "I will strike every horse with terror, and his rider with madness; and I will open my eyes on the house of Judah, and will strike every horse of the peoples with blindness.

name: Zechariah 12:5
text: The chieftains of Judah will say in their heart, "The inhabitants of Jerusalem are my strength in Yahweh of Armies their God."

name: Zechariah 12:6
text: In that day I will make the chieftains of Judah like a pan of fire among wood, and like a flaming torch among sheaves; and they will devour all the surrounding peoples, on the right hand and on the left; and Jerusalem will yet again dwell in their own place, even in Jerusalem.

name: Zechariah 12:7
text: Yahweh also will save the tents of Judah first, that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem not be magnified above Judah.

name: Zechariah 12:8
text: In that day Yahweh will defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem. He who is feeble among them at that day will be like David, and the house of David will be like God, like the angel of Yahweh before them.

name: Zechariah 12:9
text: It will happen in that day, that I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.

name: Zechariah 12:10
text: I will pour on the house of David, and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the spirit of grace and of supplication; and they will look to me whom they have pierced; and they shall mourn for him, as one mourns for his only son, and will grieve bitterly for him, as one grieves for his firstborn.

name: Zechariah 12:11
text: In that day there will be a great mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon.

name: Zechariah 12:12
text: The land will mourn, every family apart; the family of the house of David apart, and their wives apart; the family of the house of Nathan apart, and their wives apart;

name: Zechariah 12:13
text: the family of the house of Levi apart, and their wives apart; the family of the Shimeites apart, and their wives apart;

name: Zechariah 12:14
text: all the families who remain, every family apart, and their wives apart.

name: Zechariah 13:1
text: "In that day there will be a spring opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for uncleanness.

name: Zechariah 13:2
text: It will come to pass in that day, says Yahweh of Armies, that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land, and they will be remembered no more. I will also cause the prophets and the spirit of impurity to pass out of the land.

name: Zechariah 13:3
text: It will happen that, when anyone still prophesies, then his father and his mother who bore him will tell him, "You must die, because you speak lies in the name of Yahweh;" and his father and his mother who bore him will stab him when he prophesies.

name: Zechariah 13:4
text: It will happen in that day, that the prophets will each be ashamed of his vision, when he prophesies; neither will they wear a hairy mantle to deceive:

name: Zechariah 13:5
text: but he will say, "I am no prophet, I am a tiller of the ground; for I have been made a bondservant from my youth."

name: Zechariah 13:6
text: One will say to him, "What are these wounds between your arms?" Then he will answer, "Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends."

name: Zechariah 13:7
text: "Awake, sword, against my shepherd, and against the man who is close to me," says Yahweh of Armies. "Strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered; and I will turn my hand against the little ones.

name: Zechariah 13:8
text: It shall happen that in all the land," says Yahweh, "two parts in it will be cut off and die; but the third will be left in it.

name: Zechariah 13:9
text: I will bring the third part into the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and will test them like gold is tested. They will call on my name, and I will hear them. I will say, "It is my people;" and they will say, "Yahweh is my God.""

name: Zechariah 14:1
text: Behold, a day of Yahweh comes, when your spoil will be divided in your midst.

name: Zechariah 14:2
text: For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city will be taken, the houses rifled, and the women ravished. Half of the city will go out into captivity, and the rest of the people will not be cut off from the city.

name: Zechariah 14:3
text: Then Yahweh will go out and fight against those nations, as when he fought in the day of battle.

name: Zechariah 14:4
text: His feet will stand in that day on the Mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east; and the Mount of Olives will be split in two, from east to west, making a very great valley. Half of the mountain will move toward the north, and half of it toward the south.

name: Zechariah 14:5
text: You shall flee by the valley of my mountains; for the valley of the mountains shall reach to Azel; yes, you shall flee, just like you fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. Yahweh my God will come, and all the holy ones with you.

name: Zechariah 14:6
text: It will happen in that day, that there will not be light, cold, or frost.

name: Zechariah 14:7
text: It will be a unique day which is known to Yahweh; not day, and not night; but it will come to pass, that at evening time there will be light.

name: Zechariah 14:8
text: It will happen in that day, that living waters will go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the eastern sea, and half of them toward the western sea; in summer and in winter will it be.

name: Zechariah 14:9
text: Yahweh will be King over all the earth. In that day Yahweh will be one, and his name one.

name: Zechariah 14:10
text: All the land will be made like the Arabah, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem; and she will be lifted up, and will dwell in her place, from Benjamin"s gate to the place of the first gate, to the corner gate, and from the tower of Hananel to the king"s winepresses.

name: Zechariah 14:11
text: Men will dwell therein, and there will be no more curse; but Jerusalem will dwell safely.

name: Zechariah 14:12
text: This will be the plague with which Yahweh will strike all the peoples who have warred against Jerusalem: their flesh will consume away while they stand on their feet, and their eyes will consume away in their sockets, and their tongue will consume away in their mouth.

name: Zechariah 14:13
text: It will happen in that day, that a great panic from Yahweh will be among them; and they will lay hold everyone on the hand of his neighbor, and his hand will rise up against the hand of his neighbor.

name: Zechariah 14:14
text: Judah also will fight at Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the surrounding nations will be gathered together: gold, and silver, and clothing, in great abundance.

name: Zechariah 14:15
text: So will be the plague of the horse, of the mule, of the camel, and of the donkey, and of all the animals that will be in those camps, as that plague.

name: Zechariah 14:16
text: It will happen that everyone who is left of all the nations that came against Jerusalem will go up from year to year to worship the King, Yahweh of Armies, and to keep the feast of tents.

name: Zechariah 14:17
text: It will be, that whoever of all the families of the earth doesn"t go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, Yahweh of Armies, on them there will be no rain.

name: Zechariah 14:18
text: If the family of Egypt doesn"t go up, and doesn"t come, neither will it rain on them. This will be the plague with which Yahweh will strike the nations that don"t go up to keep the feast of tents.

name: Zechariah 14:19
text: This will be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all the nations that don"t go up to keep the feast of tents.

name: Zechariah 14:20
text: In that day there will be on the bells of the horses, "HOLY TO YAHWEH;" and the pots in Yahweh"s house will be like the bowls before the altar.

name: Zechariah 14:21
text: Yes, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holy to Yahweh of Armies; and all those who sacrifice will come and take of them, and cook in them. In that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 1:1
text: An oracle: the word of Yahweh to Israel by Malachi.

name: Malachi 1:2
text: "I have loved you," says Yahweh. Yet you say, "How have you loved us?" "Wasn"t Esau Jacob"s brother?" says Yahweh, "Yet I loved Jacob;

name: Malachi 1:3
text: but Esau I hated, and made his mountains a desolation, and gave his heritage to the jackals of the wilderness."

name: Malachi 1:4
text: Whereas Edom says, "We are beaten down, but we will return and build the waste places;" thus says Yahweh of Armies, "They shall build, but I will throw down; and men will call them "The Wicked Land," even the people against whom Yahweh shows wrath forever."

name: Malachi 1:5
text: Your eyes will see, and you will say, "Yahweh is great"even beyond the border of Israel!"

name: Malachi 1:6
text: "A son honors his father, and a servant his master. If I am a father, then where is my honor? And if I am a master, where is the respect due me? Says Yahweh of Armies to you, priests, who despise my name. You say, "How have we despised your name?"

name: Malachi 1:7
text: You offer polluted bread on my altar. You say, "How have we polluted you?" In that you say, "Yahweh"s table contemptible."

name: Malachi 1:8
text: When you offer the blind for sacrifice, isn"t that evil? And when you offer the lame and sick, isn"t that evil? Present it now to your governor! Will he be pleased with you? Or will he accept your person?" says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 1:9
text: "Now, please entreat the favor of God, that he may be gracious to us. With this, will he accept any of you?" says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 1:10
text: "Oh that there were one among you who would shut the doors, that you might not kindle fire on my altar in vain! I have no pleasure in you," says Yahweh of Armies, "neither will I accept an offering at your hand.

name: Malachi 1:11
text: For from the rising of the sun even to the going down of the same, my name is great among the nations, and in every place incense will be offered to my name, and a pure offering: for my name is great among the nations," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 1:12
text: "But you profane it, in that you say, "Yahweh"s table is polluted, and its fruit, even its food, is contemptible."

name: Malachi 1:13
text: You say also, "Behold, what a weariness it is!" and you have sniffed at it," says Yahweh of Armies; "and you have brought that which was taken by violence, the lame, and the sick; thus you bring the offering. Should I accept this at your hand?" says Yahweh.

name: Malachi 1:14
text: "But the deceiver is cursed, who has in his flock a male, and vows, and sacrifices to the Lord a blemished thing; for I am a great King," says Yahweh of Armies, "and my name is awesome among the nations."

name: Malachi 2:1
text: "Now, you priests, this commandment is for you.

name: Malachi 2:2
text: If you will not listen, and if you will not lay it to heart, to give glory to my name," says Yahweh of Armies, "then will I send the curse on you, and I will curse your blessings. Indeed, I have cursed them already, because you do not lay it to heart.

name: Malachi 2:3
text: Behold, I will rebuke your seed, and will spread dung on your faces, even the dung of your feasts; and you will be taken away with it.

name: Malachi 2:4
text: You will know that I have sent this commandment to you, that my covenant may be with Levi," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 2:5
text: "My covenant was with him of life and peace; and I gave them to him that he might be reverent toward me; and he was reverent toward me, and stood in awe of my name.

name: Malachi 2:6
text: The law of truth was in his mouth, and unrighteousness was not found in his lips. He walked with me in peace and uprightness, and turned many away from iniquity.

name: Malachi 2:7
text: For the priest"s lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at his mouth; for he is the messenger of Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 2:8
text: But you have turned aside out of the way. You have caused many to stumble in the law. You have corrupted the covenant of Levi," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 2:9
text: "Therefore I have also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according to the way you have not kept my ways, but have had respect for persons in the law.

name: Malachi 2:10
text: Don"t we all have one father? Hasn"t one God created us? Why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, profaning the covenant of our fathers?

name: Malachi 2:11
text: Judah has dealt treacherously, and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah has profaned the holiness of Yahweh which he loves, and has married the daughter of a foreign god.

name: Malachi 2:12
text: Yahweh will cut off, to the man who does this, him who wakes and him who answers, out of the tents of Jacob, and him who offers an offering to Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 2:13
text: This again you do: you cover the altar of Yahweh with tears, with weeping, and with sighing, because he doesn"t regard the offering any more, neither receives it with good will at your hand.

name: Malachi 2:14
text: Yet you say, "Why?" Because Yahweh has been witness between you and the wife of your youth, against whom you have dealt treacherously, though she is your companion, and the wife of your covenant.

name: Malachi 2:15
text: Did he not make you one, although he had the residue of the Spirit? Why one? He sought a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit, and let no one deal treacherously against the wife of his youth.

name: Malachi 2:16
text: For I hate divorce," says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "and him who covers his garment with violence!" says Yahweh of Armies. "Therefore take heed to your spirit, that you don"t deal treacherously.

name: Malachi 2:17
text: You have wearied Yahweh with your words. Yet you say, "How have we wearied him?" In that you say, "Everyone who does evil is good in the sight of Yahweh, and he delights in them;" or "Where is the God of justice?"

name: Malachi 3:1
text: "Behold, I send my messenger, and he will prepare the way before me; and the Lord, whom you seek, will suddenly come to his temple; and the messenger of the covenant, whom you desire, behold, he comes!" says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 3:2
text: "But who can endure the day of his coming? And who will stand when he appears? For he is like a refiner"s fire, and like launderer"s soap;

name: Malachi 3:3
text: and he will sit as a refiner and purifier of silver, and he will purify the sons of Levi, and refine them as gold and silver; and they shall offer to Yahweh offerings in righteousness.

name: Malachi 3:4
text: Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem will be pleasant to Yahweh, as in the days of old, and as in ancient years.

name: Malachi 3:5
text: I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against the perjurers, and against those who oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and who deprive the foreigner of justice, and don"t fear me," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 3:6
text: "For I, Yahweh, don"t change; therefore you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed.

name: Malachi 3:7
text: From the days of your fathers you have turned aside from my ordinances, and have not kept them. Return to me, and I will return to you," says Yahweh of Armies. "But you say, "How shall we return?"

name: Malachi 3:8
text: Will a man rob God? Yet you rob me! But you say, "How have we robbed you?" In tithes and offerings.

name: Malachi 3:9
text: You are cursed with the curse; for you rob me, even this whole nation.

name: Malachi 3:10
text: Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house, and test me now in this," says Yahweh of Armies, "if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there shall not be room enough for.

name: Malachi 3:11
text: I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, and he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; neither shall your vine cast its fruit before its time in the field," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 3:12
text: "All nations shall call you blessed, for you will be a delightful land," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 3:13
text: "Your words have been stout against me," says Yahweh. "Yet you say, "What have we spoken against you?"

name: Malachi 3:14
text: You have said, "It is vain to serve God;" and "What profit is it that we have followed his instructions, and that we have walked mournfully before Yahweh of Armies?

name: Malachi 3:15
text: Now we call the proud happy; yes, those who work wickedness are built up; yes, they tempt God, and escape."

name: Malachi 3:16
text: Then those who feared Yahweh spoke one with another; and Yahweh listened, and heard, and a book of memory was written before him, for those who feared Yahweh, and who honored his name.

name: Malachi 3:17
text: They shall be mine," says Yahweh of Armies, "my own possession in the day that I make, and I will spare them, as a man spares his own son who serves him.

name: Malachi 3:18
text: Then you shall return and discern between the righteous and the wicked, between him who serves God and him who doesn"t serve him.

name: Malachi 4:1
text: "For, behold, the day comes, it burns as a furnace; and all the proud, and all who work wickedness, will be stubble; and the day that comes will burn them up," says Yahweh of Armies, "that it shall leave them neither root nor branch.

name: Malachi 4:2
text: But to you who fear my name shall the sun of righteousness arise with healing in its wings. You will go out, and leap like calves of the stall.

name: Malachi 4:3
text: You shall tread down the wicked; for they will be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I make," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Malachi 4:4
text: "Remember the law of Moses my servant, which I commanded to him in Horeb for all Israel, even statutes and ordinances.

name: Malachi 4:5
text: Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet before the great and terrible day of Yahweh comes.

name: Malachi 4:6
text: He will turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the hearts of the children to their fathers, lest I come and strike the earth with a curse."

name: Matthew 1:1
text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

name: Matthew 1:2
text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers.

name: Matthew 1:3
text: Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.

name: Matthew 1:4
text: Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.

name: Matthew 1:5
text: Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.

name: Matthew 1:6
text: Jesse became the father of King David. David became the father of Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.

name: Matthew 1:7
text: Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.

name: Matthew 1:8
text: Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.

name: Matthew 1:9
text: Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.

name: Matthew 1:10
text: Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.

name: Matthew 1:11
text: Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon.

name: Matthew 1:12
text: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel.

name: Matthew 1:13
text: Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.

name: Matthew 1:14
text: Azor became the father of Sadoc. Sadoc became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.

name: Matthew 1:15
text: Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.

name: Matthew 1:16
text: Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

name: Matthew 1:17
text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ, fourteen generations.

name: Matthew 1:18
text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this; for after his mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.

name: Matthew 1:19
text: Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly.

name: Matthew 1:20
text: But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, "Joseph, son of David, don"t be afraid to take to yourself Mary, your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.

name: Matthew 1:21
text: She shall bring forth a son. You shall call his name Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins."

name: Matthew 1:22
text: Now all this has happened, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

name: Matthew 1:23
text: "Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son. They shall call his name Immanuel;" which is, being interpreted, "God with us."

name: Matthew 1:24
text: Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;

name: Matthew 1:25
text: and didn"t know her sexually until she had brought forth her firstborn son. He named him Jesus.

name: Matthew 2:1
text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying,

name: Matthew 2:2
text: "Where is he who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him."

name: Matthew 2:3
text: When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

name: Matthew 2:4
text: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them where the Christ would be born.

name: Matthew 2:5
text: They said to him, "In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet,

name: Matthew 2:6
text: "You Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the princes of Judah: for out of you shall come forth a governor, who shall shepherd my people, Israel.""

name: Matthew 2:7
text: Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and learned from them exactly what time the star appeared.

name: Matthew 2:8
text: He sent them to Bethlehem, and said, "Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him."

name: Matthew 2:9
text: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.

name: Matthew 2:10
text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.

name: Matthew 2:11
text: They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

name: Matthew 2:12
text: Being warned in a dream that they shouldn"t return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way.

name: Matthew 2:13
text: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, "Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him."

name: Matthew 2:14
text: He arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt,

name: Matthew 2:15
text: and was there until the death of Herod; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, "Out of Egypt I called my son."

name: Matthew 2:16
text: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked by the wise men, was exceedingly angry, and sent out, and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men.

name: Matthew 2:17
text: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,

name: Matthew 2:18
text: "A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she wouldn"t be comforted, because they are no more."

name: Matthew 2:19
text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,

name: Matthew 2:20
text: "Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child"s life are dead."

name: Matthew 2:21
text: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

name: Matthew 2:22
text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there. Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee,

name: Matthew 2:23
text: and came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets: "He will be called a Nazarene."

name: Matthew 3:1
text: In those days, John the Baptizer came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,

name: Matthew 3:2
text: "Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!"

name: Matthew 3:3
text: For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying, "The voice of one crying in the wilderness, make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight."

name: Matthew 3:4
text: Now John himself wore clothing made of camel"s hair, with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.

name: Matthew 3:5
text: Then people from Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him.

name: Matthew 3:6
text: They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.

name: Matthew 3:7
text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, "You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

name: Matthew 3:8
text: Therefore bring forth fruit worthy of repentance!

name: Matthew 3:9
text: Don"t think to yourselves, "We have Abraham for our father," for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.

name: Matthew 3:10
text: "Even now the axe lies at the root of the trees. Therefore, every tree that doesn"t bring forth good fruit is cut down, and cast into the fire.

name: Matthew 3:11
text: I indeed baptize you in water for repentance, but he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.

name: Matthew 3:12
text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire."

name: Matthew 3:13
text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

name: Matthew 3:14
text: But John would have hindered him, saying, "I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?"

name: Matthew 3:15
text: But Jesus, answering, said to him, "Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness." Then he allowed him.

name: Matthew 3:16
text: Jesus, when he was baptized, went up directly from the water: and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming on him.

name: Matthew 3:17
text: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said, "This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased."

name: Matthew 4:1
text: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

name: Matthew 4:2
text: When he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry afterward.

name: Matthew 4:3
text: The tempter came and said to him, "If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread."

name: Matthew 4:4
text: But he answered, "It is written, "Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.""

name: Matthew 4:5
text: Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple,

name: Matthew 4:6
text: and said to him, "If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, "He will put his angels in charge of you." and, "On their hands they will bear you up, so that you don"t dash your foot against a stone.""

name: Matthew 4:7
text: Jesus said to him, "Again, it is written, "You shall not test the Lord, your God.""

name: Matthew 4:8
text: Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory.

name: Matthew 4:9
text: He said to him, "I will give you all of these things, if you will fall down and worship me."

name: Matthew 4:10
text: Then Jesus said to him, "Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, "You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.""

name: Matthew 4:11
text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and served him.

name: Matthew 4:12
text: Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee.

name: Matthew 4:13
text: Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,

name: Matthew 4:14
text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

name: Matthew 4:15
text: "The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,

name: Matthew 4:16
text: the people who sat in darkness saw a great light, to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, to them light has dawned."

name: Matthew 4:17
text: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say, "Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand."

name: Matthew 4:18
text: Walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers: Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.

name: Matthew 4:19
text: He said to them, "Come after me, and I will make you fishers for men."

name: Matthew 4:20
text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.

name: Matthew 4:21
text: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them.

name: Matthew 4:22
text: They immediately left the boat and their father, and followed him.

name: Matthew 4:23
text: Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

name: Matthew 4:24
text: The report about him went out into all Syria. They brought to him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them.

name: Matthew 4:25
text: Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him.

name: Matthew 5:1
text: Seeing the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him.

name: Matthew 5:2
text: He opened his mouth and taught them, saying,

name: Matthew 5:3
text: "Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

name: Matthew 5:4
text: Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

name: Matthew 5:5
text: Blessed are the gentle, for they shall inherit the earth.

name: Matthew 5:6
text: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled.

name: Matthew 5:7
text: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.

name: Matthew 5:8
text: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

name: Matthew 5:9
text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called children of God.

name: Matthew 5:10
text: Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness" sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

name: Matthew 5:11
text: "Blessed are you when people reproach you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

name: Matthew 5:12
text: Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven. For that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

name: Matthew 5:13
text: "You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? It is then good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men.

name: Matthew 5:14
text: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill can"t be hidden.

name: Matthew 5:15
text: Neither do you light a lamp, and put it under a measuring basket, but on a stand; and it shines to all who are in the house.

name: Matthew 5:16
text: Even so, let your light shine before men; that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven.

name: Matthew 5:17
text: "Don"t think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I didn"t come to destroy, but to fulfill.

name: Matthew 5:18
text: For most certainly, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law, until all things are accomplished.

name: Matthew 5:19
text: Whoever, therefore, shall break one of these least commandments, and teach others to do so, shall be called least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whoever shall do and teach them shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.

name: Matthew 5:20
text: For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, there is no way you will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

name: Matthew 5:21
text: "You have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, "You shall not murder;" and "Whoever shall murder shall be in danger of the judgment."

name: Matthew 5:22
text: But I tell you, that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment; and whoever shall say to his brother, "Raca!" shall be in danger of the council; and whoever shall say, "You fool!" shall be in danger of the fire of Gehenna.

name: Matthew 5:23
text: "If therefore you are offering your gift at the altar, and there remember that your brother has anything against you,

name: Matthew 5:24
text: leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.

name: Matthew 5:25
text: Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are with him in the way; lest perhaps the prosecutor deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be cast into prison.

name: Matthew 5:26
text: Most certainly I tell you, you shall by no means get out of there, until you have paid the last penny.

name: Matthew 5:27
text: "You have heard that it was said, "You shall not commit adultery;"

name: Matthew 5:28
text: but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.

name: Matthew 5:29
text: If your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

name: Matthew 5:30
text: If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off, and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

name: Matthew 5:31
text: "It was also said, "Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorce,"

name: Matthew 5:32
text: but I tell you that whoever puts away his wife, except for the cause of sexual immorality, makes her an adulteress; and whoever marries her when she is put away commits adultery.

name: Matthew 5:33
text: "Again you have heard that it was said to them of old time, "You shall not make false vows, but shall perform to the Lord your vows,"

name: Matthew 5:34
text: but I tell you, don"t swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

name: Matthew 5:35
text: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

name: Matthew 5:36
text: Neither shall you swear by your head, for you can"t make one hair white or black.

name: Matthew 5:37
text: But let your "Yes" be "Yes" and your "No" be "No." Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.

name: Matthew 5:38
text: "You have heard that it was said, "An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth."

name: Matthew 5:39
text: But I tell you, don"t resist him who is evil; but whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other also.

name: Matthew 5:40
text: If anyone sues you to take away your coat, let him have your cloak also.

name: Matthew 5:41
text: Whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.

name: Matthew 5:42
text: Give to him who asks you, and don"t turn away him who desires to borrow from you.

name: Matthew 5:43
text: "You have heard that it was said, "You shall love your neighbor, and hate your enemy."

name: Matthew 5:44
text: But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you,

name: Matthew 5:45
text: that you may be children of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the just and the unjust.

name: Matthew 5:46
text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Don"t even the tax collectors do the same?

name: Matthew 5:47
text: If you only greet your friends, what more do you do than others? Don"t even the tax collectors do the same?

name: Matthew 5:48
text: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.

name: Matthew 6:1
text: "Be careful that you don"t do your charitable giving before men, to be seen by them, or else you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

name: Matthew 6:2
text: Therefore when you do merciful deeds, don"t sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

name: Matthew 6:3
text: But when you do merciful deeds, don"t let your left hand know what your right hand does,

name: Matthew 6:4
text: so that your merciful deeds may be in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

name: Matthew 6:5
text: "When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Most certainly, I tell you, they have received their reward.

name: Matthew 6:6
text: But you, when you pray, enter into your inner room, and having shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

name: Matthew 6:7
text: In praying, don"t use vain repetitions, as the Gentiles do; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.

name: Matthew 6:8
text: Therefore don"t be like them, for your Father knows what things you need, before you ask him.

name: Matthew 6:9
text: Pray like this: "Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy.

name: Matthew 6:10
text: Let your Kingdom come. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

name: Matthew 6:11
text: Give us today our daily bread.

name: Matthew 6:12
text: Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.

name: Matthew 6:13
text: Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one. For yours is the Kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen."

name: Matthew 6:14
text: "For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

name: Matthew 6:15
text: But if you don"t forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

name: Matthew 6:16
text: "Moreover when you fast, don"t be like the hypocrites, with sad faces. For they disfigure their faces, that they may be seen by men to be fasting. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

name: Matthew 6:17
text: But you, when you fast, anoint your head, and wash your face;

name: Matthew 6:18
text: so that you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

name: Matthew 6:19
text: "Don"t lay up treasures for yourselves on the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal;

name: Matthew 6:20
text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don"t break through and steal;

name: Matthew 6:21
text: for where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

name: Matthew 6:22
text: "The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light.

name: Matthew 6:23
text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

name: Matthew 6:24
text: "No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can"t serve both God and Mammon.

name: Matthew 6:25
text: Therefore, I tell you, don"t be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn"t life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

name: Matthew 6:26
text: See the birds of the sky, that they don"t sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren"t you of much more value than they?

name: Matthew 6:27
text: "Which of you, by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?

name: Matthew 6:28
text: Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don"t toil, neither do they spin,

name: Matthew 6:29
text: yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.

name: Matthew 6:30
text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won"t he much more clothe you, you of little faith?

name: Matthew 6:31
text: "Therefore don"t be anxious, saying, "What will we eat?", "What will we drink?" or, "With what will we be clothed?"

name: Matthew 6:32
text: For the Gentiles seek after all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.

name: Matthew 6:33
text: But seek first God"s Kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well.

name: Matthew 6:34
text: Therefore don"t be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day"s own evil is sufficient.

name: Matthew 7:1
text: "Don"t judge, so that you won"t be judged.

name: Matthew 7:2
text: For with whatever judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you.

name: Matthew 7:3
text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother"s eye, but don"t consider the beam that is in your own eye?

name: Matthew 7:4
text: Or how will you tell your brother, "Let me remove the speck from your eye;" and behold, the beam is in your own eye?

name: Matthew 7:5
text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother"s eye.

name: Matthew 7:6
text: "Don"t give that which is holy to the dogs, neither throw your pearls before the pigs, lest perhaps they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.

name: Matthew 7:7
text: "Ask, and it will be given you. Seek, and you will find. Knock, and it will be opened for you.

name: Matthew 7:8
text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.

name: Matthew 7:9
text: Or who is there among you, who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

name: Matthew 7:10
text: Or if he asks for a fish, who will give him a serpent?

name: Matthew 7:11
text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

name: Matthew 7:12
text: Therefore whatever you desire for men to do to you, you shall also do to them; for this is the law and the prophets.

name: Matthew 7:13
text: "Enter in by the narrow gate; for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter in by it.

name: Matthew 7:14
text: How narrow is the gate, and restricted is the way that leads to life! Few are those who find it.

name: Matthew 7:15
text: "Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep"s clothing, but inwardly are ravening wolves.

name: Matthew 7:16
text: By their fruits you will know them. Do you gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

name: Matthew 7:17
text: Even so, every good tree produces good fruit; but the corrupt tree produces evil fruit.

name: Matthew 7:18
text: A good tree can"t produce evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree produce good fruit.

name: Matthew 7:19
text: Every tree that doesn"t grow good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.

name: Matthew 7:20
text: Therefore, by their fruits you will know them.

name: Matthew 7:21
text: Not everyone who says to me, "Lord, Lord," will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven; but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

name: Matthew 7:22
text: Many will tell me in that day, "Lord, Lord, didn"t we prophesy in your name, in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many mighty works?"

name: Matthew 7:23
text: Then I will tell them, "I never knew you. Depart from me, you who work iniquity."

name: Matthew 7:24
text: "Everyone therefore who hears these words of mine, and does them, I will liken him to a wise man, who built his house on a rock.

name: Matthew 7:25
text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it didn"t fall, for it was founded on the rock.

name: Matthew 7:26
text: Everyone who hears these words of mine, and doesn"t do them will be like a foolish man, who built his house on the sand.

name: Matthew 7:27
text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it fell"and great was its fall."

name: Matthew 7:28
text: It happened, when Jesus had finished saying these things, that the multitudes were astonished at his teaching,

name: Matthew 7:29
text: for he taught them with authority, and not like the scribes.

name: Matthew 8:1
text: When he came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

name: Matthew 8:2
text: Behold, a leper came to him and worshiped him, saying, "Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean."

name: Matthew 8:3
text: Jesus stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, "I want to. Be made clean." Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

name: Matthew 8:4
text: Jesus said to him, "See that you tell nobody, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them."

name: Matthew 8:5
text: When he came into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking him,

name: Matthew 8:6
text: and saying, "Lord, my servant lies in the house paralyzed, grievously tormented."

name: Matthew 8:7
text: Jesus said to him, "I will come and heal him."

name: Matthew 8:8
text: The centurion answered, "Lord, I"m not worthy for you to come under my roof. Just say the word, and my servant will be healed.

name: Matthew 8:9
text: For I am also a man under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, "Go," and he goes; and tell another, "Come," and he comes; and tell my servant, "Do this," and he does it."

name: Matthew 8:10
text: When Jesus heard it, he marveled, and said to those who followed, "Most certainly I tell you, I haven"t found so great a faith, not even in Israel.

name: Matthew 8:11
text: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven,

name: Matthew 8:12
text: but the children of the Kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth."

name: Matthew 8:13
text: Jesus said to the centurion, "Go your way. Let it be done for you as you have believed." His servant was healed in that hour.

name: Matthew 8:14
text: When Jesus came into Peter"s house, he saw his wife"s mother lying sick with a fever.

name: Matthew 8:15
text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and served him.

name: Matthew 8:16
text: When evening came, they brought to him many possessed with demons. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick;

name: Matthew 8:17
text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying: "He took our infirmities, and bore our diseases."

name: Matthew 8:18
text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes around him, he gave the order to depart to the other side.

name: Matthew 8:19
text: A scribe came, and said to him, "Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go."

name: Matthew 8:20
text: Jesus said to him, "The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head."

name: Matthew 8:21
text: Another of his disciples said to him, "Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father."

name: Matthew 8:22
text: But Jesus said to him, "Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead."

name: Matthew 8:23
text: When he got into a boat, his disciples followed him.

name: Matthew 8:24
text: Behold, a violent storm came up on the sea, so much that the boat was covered with the waves, but he was asleep.

name: Matthew 8:25
text: They came to him, and woke him up, saying, "Save us, Lord! We are dying!"

name: Matthew 8:26
text: He said to them, "Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?" Then he got up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.

name: Matthew 8:27
text: The men marveled, saying, "What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?"

name: Matthew 8:28
text: When he came to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two people possessed by demons met him there, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that nobody could pass that way.

name: Matthew 8:29
text: Behold, they cried out, saying, "What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?"

name: Matthew 8:30
text: Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding far away from them.

name: Matthew 8:31
text: The demons begged him, saying, "If you cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of pigs."

name: Matthew 8:32
text: He said to them, "Go!" They came out, and went into the herd of pigs: and behold, the whole herd of pigs rushed down the cliff into the sea, and died in the water.

name: Matthew 8:33
text: Those who fed them fled, and went away into the city, and told everything, including what happened to those who were possessed with demons.

name: Matthew 8:34
text: Behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged that he would depart from their borders.

name: Matthew 9:1
text: He entered into a boat, and crossed over, and came into his own city.

name: Matthew 9:2
text: Behold, they brought to him a man who was paralyzed, lying on a bed. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, "Son, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven you."

name: Matthew 9:3
text: Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, "This man blasphemes."

name: Matthew 9:4
text: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, "Why do you think evil in your hearts?

name: Matthew 9:5
text: For which is easier, to say, "Your sins are forgiven;" or to say, "Get up, and walk?"

name: Matthew 9:6
text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins..." (then he said to the paralytic), "Get up, and take up your mat, and go up to your house."

name: Matthew 9:7
text: He arose and departed to his house.

name: Matthew 9:8
text: But when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such authority to men.

name: Matthew 9:9
text: As Jesus passed by from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax collection office. He said to him, "Follow me." He got up and followed him.

name: Matthew 9:10
text: It happened as he sat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.

name: Matthew 9:11
text: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, "Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?"

name: Matthew 9:12
text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, "Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.

name: Matthew 9:13
text: But you go and learn what this means: "I desire mercy, and not sacrifice," for I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."

name: Matthew 9:14
text: Then John"s disciples came to him, saying, "Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don"t fast?"

name: Matthew 9:15
text: Jesus said to them, "Can the friends of the bridegroom mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.

name: Matthew 9:16
text: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch would tear away from the garment, and a worse hole is made.

name: Matthew 9:17
text: Neither do people put new wine into old wineskins, or else the skins would burst, and the wine be spilled, and the skins ruined. No, they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved."

name: Matthew 9:18
text: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying, "My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live."

name: Matthew 9:19
text: Jesus got up and followed him, as did his disciples.

name: Matthew 9:20
text: Behold, a woman who had an issue of blood for twelve years came behind him, and touched the fringe of his garment;

name: Matthew 9:21
text: for she said within herself, "If I just touch his garment, I will be made well."

name: Matthew 9:22
text: But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said, "Daughter, cheer up! Your faith has made you well." And the woman was made well from that hour.

name: Matthew 9:23
text: When Jesus came into the ruler"s house, and saw the flute players, and the crowd in noisy disorder,

name: Matthew 9:24
text: he said to them, "Make room, because the girl isn"t dead, but sleeping." They were ridiculing him.

name: Matthew 9:25
text: But when the crowd was put out, he entered in, took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

name: Matthew 9:26
text: The report of this went out into all that land.

name: Matthew 9:27
text: As Jesus passed by from there, two blind men followed him, calling out and saying, "Have mercy on us, son of David!"

name: Matthew 9:28
text: When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, "Do you believe that I am able to do this?" They told him, "Yes, Lord."

name: Matthew 9:29
text: Then he touched their eyes, saying, "According to your faith be it done to you."

name: Matthew 9:30
text: Their eyes were opened. Jesus strictly commanded them, saying, "See that no one knows about this."

name: Matthew 9:31
text: But they went out and spread abroad his fame in all that land.

name: Matthew 9:32
text: As they went out, behold, a mute man who was demon possessed was brought to him.

name: Matthew 9:33
text: When the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. The multitudes marveled, saying, "Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!"

name: Matthew 9:34
text: But the Pharisees said, "By the prince of the demons, he casts out demons."

name: Matthew 9:35
text: Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

name: Matthew 9:36
text: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them, because they were harassed and scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.

name: Matthew 9:37
text: Then he said to his disciples, "The harvest indeed is plentiful, but the laborers are few.

name: Matthew 9:38
text: Pray therefore that the Lord of the harvest will send out laborers into his harvest."

name: Matthew 10:1
text: He called to himself his twelve disciples, and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every disease and every sickness.

name: Matthew 10:2
text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these. The first, Simon, who is called Peter; Andrew, his brother; James the son of Zebedee; John, his brother;

name: Matthew 10:3
text: Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus; Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

name: Matthew 10:4
text: Simon the Canaanite; and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

name: Matthew 10:5
text: Jesus sent these twelve out, and commanded them, saying, "Don"t go among the Gentiles, and don"t enter into any city of the Samaritans.

name: Matthew 10:6
text: Rather, go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

name: Matthew 10:7
text: As you go, preach, saying, "The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!"

name: Matthew 10:8
text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, and cast out demons. Freely you received, so freely give.

name: Matthew 10:9
text: Don"t take any gold, nor silver, nor brass in your money belts.

name: Matthew 10:10
text: Take no bag for your journey, neither two coats, nor shoes, nor staff: for the laborer is worthy of his food.

name: Matthew 10:11
text: Into whatever city or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy; and stay there until you go on.

name: Matthew 10:12
text: As you enter into the household, greet it.

name: Matthew 10:13
text: If the household is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it isn"t worthy, let your peace return to you.

name: Matthew 10:14
text: Whoever doesn"t receive you, nor hear your words, as you go out of that house or that city, shake off the dust from your feet.

name: Matthew 10:15
text: Most certainly I tell you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.

name: Matthew 10:16
text: "Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

name: Matthew 10:17
text: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to councils, and in their synagogues they will scourge you.

name: Matthew 10:18
text: Yes, and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations.

name: Matthew 10:19
text: But when they deliver you up, don"t be anxious how or what you will say, for it will be given you in that hour what you will say.

name: Matthew 10:20
text: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.

name: Matthew 10:21
text: "Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

name: Matthew 10:22
text: You will be hated by all men for my name"s sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.

name: Matthew 10:23
text: But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next, for most certainly I tell you, you will not have gone through the cities of Israel, until the Son of Man has come.

name: Matthew 10:24
text: "A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his lord.

name: Matthew 10:25
text: It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher, and the servant like his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more those of his household!

name: Matthew 10:26
text: Therefore don"t be afraid of them, for there is nothing covered that will not be revealed; and hidden that will not be known.

name: Matthew 10:27
text: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.

name: Matthew 10:28
text: Don"t be afraid of those who kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul. Rather, fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.

name: Matthew 10:29
text: "Aren"t two sparrows sold for an assarion coin? Not one of them falls on the ground apart from your Father"s will,

name: Matthew 10:30
text: but the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

name: Matthew 10:31
text: Therefore don"t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.

name: Matthew 10:32
text: Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, him I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven.

name: Matthew 10:33
text: But whoever denies me before men, him I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven.

name: Matthew 10:34
text: "Don"t think that I came to send peace on the earth. I didn"t come to send peace, but a sword.

name: Matthew 10:35
text: For I came to set a man at odds against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

name: Matthew 10:36
text: A man"s foes will be those of his own household.

name: Matthew 10:37
text: He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn"t worthy of me.

name: Matthew 10:38
text: He who doesn"t take his cross and follow after me, isn"t worthy of me.

name: Matthew 10:39
text: He who seeks his life will lose it; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.

name: Matthew 10:40
text: He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me receives him who sent me.

name: Matthew 10:41
text: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet"s reward. He who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man"s reward.

name: Matthew 10:42
text: Whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, most certainly I tell you he will in no way lose his reward."

name: Matthew 11:1
text: It happened that when Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.

name: Matthew 11:2
text: Now when John heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples

name: Matthew 11:3
text: and said to him, "Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?"

name: Matthew 11:4
text: Jesus answered them, "Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:

name: Matthew 11:5
text: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

name: Matthew 11:6
text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me."

name: Matthew 11:7
text: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John, "What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

name: Matthew 11:8
text: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in king"s houses.

name: Matthew 11:9
text: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

name: Matthew 11:10
text: For this is he, of whom it is written, "Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you."

name: Matthew 11:11
text: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

name: Matthew 11:12
text: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.

name: Matthew 11:13
text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

name: Matthew 11:14
text: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.

name: Matthew 11:15
text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.

name: Matthew 11:16
text: "But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions

name: Matthew 11:17
text: and say, "We played the flute for you, and you didn"t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn"t lament."

name: Matthew 11:18
text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, "He has a demon."

name: Matthew 11:19
text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, "Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!" But wisdom is justified by her children."

name: Matthew 11:20
text: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn"t repent.

name: Matthew 11:21
text: "Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

name: Matthew 11:22
text: But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.

name: Matthew 11:23
text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until this day.

name: Matthew 11:24
text: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom, on the day of judgment, than for you."

name: Matthew 11:25
text: At that time, Jesus answered, "I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.

name: Matthew 11:26
text: Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.

name: Matthew 11:27
text: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son, and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.

name: Matthew 11:28
text: "Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.

name: Matthew 11:29
text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.

name: Matthew 11:30
text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light."

name: Matthew 12:1
text: At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields. His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.

name: Matthew 12:2
text: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him, "Behold, your disciples do what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath."

name: Matthew 12:3
text: But he said to them, "Haven"t you read what David did, when he was hungry, and those who were with him;

name: Matthew 12:4
text: how he entered into the house of God, and ate the show bread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?

name: Matthew 12:5
text: Or have you not read in the law, that on the Sabbath day, the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are guiltless?

name: Matthew 12:6
text: But I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.

name: Matthew 12:7
text: But if you had known what this means, "I desire mercy, and not sacrifice," you would not have condemned the guiltless.

name: Matthew 12:8
text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath."

name: Matthew 12:9
text: He departed there, and went into their synagogue.

name: Matthew 12:10
text: And behold there was a man with a withered hand. They asked him, "Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?" that they might accuse him.

name: Matthew 12:11
text: He said to them, "What man is there among you, who has one sheep, and if this one falls into a pit on the Sabbath day, won"t he grab on to it, and lift it out?

name: Matthew 12:12
text: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath day."

name: Matthew 12:13
text: Then he told the man, "Stretch out your hand." He stretched it out; and it was restored whole, just like the other.

name: Matthew 12:14
text: But the Pharisees went out, and conspired against him, how they might destroy him.

name: Matthew 12:15
text: Jesus, perceiving that, withdrew from there. Great multitudes followed him; and he healed them all,

name: Matthew 12:16
text: and commanded them that they should not make him known:

name: Matthew 12:17
text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

name: Matthew 12:18
text: "Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit on him. He will proclaim justice to the nations.

name: Matthew 12:19
text: He will not strive, nor shout; neither will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

name: Matthew 12:20
text: He won"t break a bruised reed. He won"t quench a smoking flax, until he leads justice to victory.

name: Matthew 12:21
text: In his name, the nations will hope."

name: Matthew 12:22
text: Then one possessed by a demon, blind and mute, was brought to him and he healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.

name: Matthew 12:23
text: All the multitudes were amazed, and said, "Can this be the son of David?"

name: Matthew 12:24
text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, "This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons."

name: Matthew 12:25
text: Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said to them, "Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.

name: Matthew 12:26
text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?

name: Matthew 12:27
text: If I by Beelzebul cast out demons, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

name: Matthew 12:28
text: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has come upon you.

name: Matthew 12:29
text: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and plunder his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? Then he will plunder his house.

name: Matthew 12:30
text: "He who is not with me is against me, and he who doesn"t gather with me, scatters.

name: Matthew 12:31
text: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.

name: Matthew 12:32
text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, neither in this age, nor in that which is to come.

name: Matthew 12:33
text: "Either make the tree good, and its fruit good, or make the tree corrupt, and its fruit corrupt; for the tree is known by its fruit.

name: Matthew 12:34
text: You offspring of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.

name: Matthew 12:35
text: The good man out of his good treasure brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things.

name: Matthew 12:36
text: I tell you that every idle word that men speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.

name: Matthew 12:37
text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned."

name: Matthew 12:38
text: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered, "Teacher, we want to see a sign from you."

name: Matthew 12:39
text: But he answered them, "An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, but no sign will be given it but the sign of Jonah the prophet.

name: Matthew 12:40
text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the whale, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

name: Matthew 12:41
text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, someone greater than Jonah is here.

name: Matthew 12:42
text: The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, someone greater than Solomon is here.

name: Matthew 12:43
text: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passes through waterless places, seeking rest, and doesn"t find it.

name: Matthew 12:44
text: Then he says, "I will return into my house from which I came out," and when he has come back, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order.

name: Matthew 12:45
text: Then he goes, and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than he is, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first. Even so will it be also to this evil generation."

name: Matthew 12:46
text: While he was yet speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brothers stood outside, seeking to speak to him.

name: Matthew 12:47
text: One said to him, "Behold, your mother and your brothers stand outside, seeking to speak to you."

name: Matthew 12:48
text: But he answered him who spoke to him, "Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?"

name: Matthew 12:49
text: He stretched out his hand towards his disciples, and said, "Behold, my mother and my brothers!

name: Matthew 12:50
text: For whoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother."

name: Matthew 13:1
text: On that day Jesus went out of the house, and sat by the seaside.

name: Matthew 13:2
text: Great multitudes gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat, and sat, and all the multitude stood on the beach.

name: Matthew 13:3
text: He spoke to them many things in parables, saying, "Behold, a farmer went out to sow.

name: Matthew 13:4
text: As he sowed, some seeds fell by the roadside, and the birds came and devoured them.

name: Matthew 13:5
text: Others fell on rocky ground, where they didn"t have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, because they had no depth of earth.

name: Matthew 13:6
text: When the sun had risen, they were scorched. Because they had no root, they withered away.

name: Matthew 13:7
